text: Stanislav Gross (30 October 1969 - 16 April 2015) was a Czech lawyer and politician. He served as the Prime Minister of the Czech Republic from 4 August 2004 to 25 April 2005. He was a member of the Czech Social Democratic Party (ČSSD), which he lead from 26 June 2004 to 26 April 2005. Gross was born in Prague. He was married to Šárka Grossová and had two daughters. He was a Christian. Gross died from amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) on 16 April 2015 in Prague, aged 45. ==References== Category:1969 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Christians Category:Deaths from motor neurone disease Category:Disease-related deaths in the Czech Republic Category:European lawyers Category:Politicians from Prague Category:Prime ministers of the Czech Republic
title: Stanislav Gross
